habitat_description:
This species occurs only in the Kaweah River drainage in Tulare County located on the western slope of the Sierra Nevada of California. Adult habitat includes mesic, north-facing slopes bordering streams, and oak woodland. This species is associated with some of the local vegetation; California buckeye, white elder, western redbud, interior live oak, Fremont cottonwood, and blue oak (Jockusch et al. 2001). Also, are found under fallen branches and leaf litter, under rocks, wet gravel at springs, and vegetation associated with springs like manzanita, currant, willows, and white fir. At higher elevations, habitat of preference are heavily forested slopes with giant sequoia, alders, ferns, sugar pine, and incense cedar where individuals can be found along wet logs and fallen debris (Lannoo 2005; Green et al. 2013). 

Cover under fallen branches and leaf litter, under rocks, wet gravel at springs, and vegetation associated with springs like manzanita, currant, willows, and white fir.
